meanings.definition: Something that prevents or slows down progress or action.
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic was a hindrance to reaching the destination on time.
meanings.sent2: The locked gate proved to be a hindrance to entering the garden.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn knot in the rope was a hindrance to the magician's trick.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure acted as a hindrance to pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead were a hindrance to the outdoor event.

meanings.sent1: The fallen tree served as a hindrance on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: Lack of funds can be a hindrance to starting a new business.
meanings.sent3: The spilled paint became an unexpected hindrance to the art project.
meanings.sent4: Miscommunication acted as a hindrance to completing the group project.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator was a hindrance to reaching the top floor.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that hinders.
meanings.sent1: The negative comments from the critic were a hindrance to his confidence.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous squirrel became a hindrance to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbor's party was a hindrance to her peaceful evening.
meanings.sent4: His constant interruptions were a hindrance to the flow of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The faulty equipment was a hindrance to the smooth operation of the factory.
